item.title: Free Girls Football Skills Festival
item.description: The FA Tesco Skills programme will be teaming up with the Kent FA and Gillingham FC to offer a free day of coaching and games for local girls aged 5-11.

item.title: Kent School through to Regional Finals
item.description: Congratulations to St Simon Stock Catholic School who were triumphant and secured a third victory in a row for the Gills at the Area Finals of The Football League Girls Cup.

item.title: Clarification regarding Summer Tournaments
item.description: Further to several queries with regards to FA Rule 4A (iii), linked to competition formats for young players in the U7 to U10 age groups, questions have arisen about the summer tournaments organised by grassroots clubs and commercial companies. The query relates to whether these events can be run as a competition, for a trophy, with a published winner.

item.title: Flood Guidance For Clubs
item.description: The recent poor weather has once again highlighted the damaging effect that floods can have on football clubs.

item.title: Managing Club Finances Seminar
item.description: The Kent FA have teamed up with Club Leaders to provide free training seminars and support to those doing the day-to-day running of Kent football clubs by helping create a robust, economically sustainable and enterprising club network.

item.title: Kent U16 Lose Out Against Sussex
item.description: Kent Under 16's finished the season with a 2-1 home defeat to Sussex in the league

item.title: National Childrens Football Alliance To Host Peace Day in Kent
item.description: With the New Year starting, 2014 marks the 100 year anniversary of the start of the First World War.

item.title: New Walking Football Sessions Announced
item.description: Kent FA has teamed up with Medway Sport to create brand new opportunities for those wishing to take part in Walking Football.

item.title: FA Charter Standard Annual Health Check
item.description: The Kent FA recently distributed the 2013/14 FA Charter Standard Annual Health Check to all Kent clubs who hold the award.
